byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

abstract: Many Kurds in southern Turkey are caught between Kurdish militants seeking minority rights and local autonomy and a Turkish central government that says it wants to make peace but fears carving up the country.
snippet: Many Kurds are caught between guerrillas seeking minority rights and local autonomy and a central government that says it wants to make peace but fears carving up the country.
lead_paragraph: Many Kurds are caught between guerrillas seeking minority rights and local autonomy and a central government that says it wants to make peace but fears carving up the country.

headline.main: For Kurds in Turkey, a Country’s Conflict Rends Families
headline.print_headline: For Kurds in Turkey, a Country’s Conflict Rends Families
headline.seo: Kurds in Turkey Rended by War That Haunts Country
